title: Hierarchical Bayesian Regression for Multi-Location Sales Transaction Forecasting. (arXiv:2306.17795v1 [stat.AP])
abstract: The features in many prediction models naturally take the form of a hierarchy. The lower levels represent individuals or events. These units group naturally into locations and intervals or other aggregates, often at multiple levels. Levels of groupings may intersect and join, much as relational database tables do. Besides representing the structure of the data, predictive features in hierarchical models can be assigned to their proper levels. Such models lend themselves to hierarchical Bayes solution methods that ``share'' results of inference between groups by generalizing over the case of individual models for each group versus one model that aggregates all groups into one.  In this paper we show our work-in-progress applying a hierarchical Bayesian model to forecast purchases throughout the day at store franchises, with groupings over locations and days of the week. translated_title: 多地点销售交易预测的层次贝叶斯回归
translated_abstract: 许多预测模型中的特征自然地形成层次结构。较低层次代表个体或事件。这些个体自然地聚集成为地点、时间间隔或其他聚合，通常有多个层次。分组的层次可以交叉和合并，就像关系数据库表一样。除了表示数据的结构外，层次模型中的预测特征可以分配到适当的层次。这样的模型适合使用层次贝叶斯解决方法，通过将推理结果在群组之间进行泛化，实现共享。在本文中，我们展示了将层次贝叶斯模型应用于预测商店特许经营店每天的购买情况的工作进展，包括对地点和每周某些天的分组。我们使用\textsf{stan}软件包展示了在一年的时间内收集的个别销售交易数据。
tldr: 本文介绍了一种层次贝叶斯回归模型，用于预测多地点销售交易，并通过共享推理结果在群组之间进行泛化。研究表明，该模型在预测商店特许经营店购买情况方面取得了进展。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a hierarchical Bayesian regression model for forecasting multi-location sales transactions, which generalizes inference results between groups by sharing and shows progress in predicting purchases at store franchises.
